meanings.sent1: The long lecture began to ennuye the students.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive tasks at work can ennuye even the most energetic employees.
meanings.sent3: The movie was so ennuye that even the popcorn fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous sound of the dripping faucet ennuyed her to the point of frustration.
meanings.sent5: The endless waiting in line ennuyed him more than anything else that day.

meanings.definition: A feeling of boredom or weariness
meanings.sent1: After hours of waiting, ennuye settled in among the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The ennuye in the classroom was palpable as the students stared blankly at the clock.
meanings.sent3: She tried to fight off the ennuye by doodling in her notebook during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The ennuye hung in the air like a heavy fog, making everyone lethargic.
meanings.sent5: The ennuye of the rainy day made her yearn for some excitement.
